definition: to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with

sentences.english: The replier said that he went to a Chrisitan high school when he was young.
sentences.chinese: 回应当中的一位网友说到自己求学时的经历。

sentences.english: The instantmessaging feature appears to be one part of Microsoft's response.
sentences.chinese: 即时通服务似乎是微软对此举动作出回应的一部分。

sentences.english: He did not respond I have only concentrated on the very floor to Dongdong Dong.
sentences.chinese: 他没有回应我，只顾咚咚咚上得楼来。

sentences.english: Will there be time for a question-and-answer segment?If so, anticipate the questions and prepare responses in advance, Ms. Blackman said.
sentences.chinese: 如果是，那么期待会问哪些问题并之前准备回应。

sentences.english: Mr Hoyt airs some good responses.
sentences.chinese: 霍伊特先生做出了很好的回应。

sentences.english: Professor McGonagall blew her nose in reply.
sentences.chinese: 麦康娜教授抽动了一下鼻子算是回应。

sentences.english: On average throughout all the quarter-million responses, minds were wandering 47 percent of the time.
sentences.chinese: 在25万回应中，平均下来思绪47%的时间在游荡。

sentences.english: Your emotions are a response to your perception.
sentences.chinese: 你的情感是感知力的回应。

sentences.english: So I was looking straight my oh myeadvertising cfeelpaign as I responded.
sentences.chinese: 于是作为回应我也直直地向前看着。

sentences.english: The sending application specifies response queues when the application sends its messages.
sentences.chinese: 传回至回应伫列的讯息是应用程式指定的。

sentences.english: And here I am ranting against somebody that doesn't have a chance to respond.
sentences.chinese: 并且在这里我还要痛斥那些此时无法作出回应的人。

sentences.english: Every time I speak, you are always there to respond back.
sentences.chinese: 每回他说话时，我总是会回应。

sentences.english: The reasons behind attempts to define what knowledge is lie in responding to sceptical arguments.
sentences.chinese: 定义知识为何物的尝试源于对怀疑论的回应。

sentences.english: After we fired back, there was no further response from the DRPK.
sentences.chinese: 我方回击后，朝方没有进一步回应。

sentences.english: Experience shows that these one-to-one campaigns achieve a high response rate.
sentences.chinese: 经验表明，这些一对一的运动获得了较高的回应率。

definition: to declare one's position/to say where one stands
clear (of liquid)/limpid/to clarify/to make sth clear/to be clear (about the facts)
to settle (of liquid)/to become clear (by precipitation of impurities)/precipitate (chemistry)/to put in order/to quell disturbances
to fight back/to return fire/to counterattack
to call into question/to question (truth or validity)
to express/to show/to say/to state/to indicate/to mean
to declare to be untrue/to deny
to issue a document/document issued by an authority/outgoing messages/(Internet) to post an article online
to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
